poem:
"Morning Greeting, a Russian School"

The headmaster's vodka bottle wink,
a suggestion of mischief before the sun's ink.
Paper-white dawn, as truth unfurls,
a welcome uncanny, in the world of schoolgirls.
No adventure to see, just life lived uncensored,
where rivers of risk and desert endure.
An ordinary canvas of tales untold,
Customs, bracing as the morning cold.
